abstract: China’s national legislature enacts new safeguards for criminal suspects and defendants, but upholds the right of the police to hold certain suspects in secret residential locations for up to six months, ignoring a last-minute online campaign by critics to curb police authority.

byline.contributor: Li Bibo and Mia Li contributed research.
